p:
T-705 is a broad-spectrum pyrazinecarboxamide ( Fig 1) that is converted intracellularly to a ribonucleoside analog through phosphoribosylation, thus competitively targeting the viral RdRP complex. Anabolism efficiency can vary between cells of different tissue origin, but has been shown to be low in disease-relevant primary human airway epithelium cells.
90 The drug has broad-spectrum antiviral activity in cell culture, inhibiting RNA viruses of the arenavirus, bunyavirus, flavivirus, alphavirus, norovirus, picornavirus, paramyxovirus, and rhabdovirus families, in addition to influenza viruses. 91, 92, 93, 94
